page.title: 04 A GOOD START TO LIFE
page.content: { Thornyflat Maternity Hospital}is one of the few amenities in this area, but serves the town of Ayr and surrounding district. Built during the war as{a sick bay {for R.A.F. officers}at the then nearby Heathfield Airfield,it was converted to a maternity hospital in 1948. This single storey,prefabricated building contains 12 small wards with accommodation for 20 patients. On average 160 babies are born in this hospital each year. It is run by a nursing officer and her staff of 33 which includes both nursing and ancillary staff. {Although it was initially meant to {last for only ten years,Thornyflat {Hospital is still going strong.
